benchmark_details.name: GenTel-Bench
benchmark_details.overview: A comprehensive evaluation benchmark designed to assess safeguarding techniques for detecting prompt injection attacks in large language models.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a unified framework for defending against prompt injection attacks and comprehensive evaluation benchmarks.
tasks: Benchmark performance against prompt injection attacks
out_of_scope_uses: Personal use not aligned with research
Commercial exploitation of the tool without authorization

data.source: Combined from public platforms and established datasets for LLM applications.
data.size: Over 170,000 data points comprising benign samples and 84,812 prompt injection attacks.
data.annotation: Data has been labeled as harmful injection attack samples and benign samples by domain experts.

methods: Model training using multilingual E5 text embedding models
methodology.calculation: Standard classification metrics calculated to evaluate the model's performance.
methodology.interpretation: Performance metrics indicate the effectiveness of prompt injection detection against various attack types.
methodology.validation: Empirical testing against various existing models.

harm: Reputational damage due to harmful outputs

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Prompt injection attacks may expose sensitive information.
